intro: Castilleja oreopola, commonly known as the Sierra red paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its striking red to orange flowers. The plant has a slender, erect stem and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Castilleja oreopola relies on other plants for some of its nutrients, making it an important component of its ecosystem.
